bestBHT.bht: The remarkable awakening in this incident produced a surge of genuine belief, as many more people acknowledged Jesus as the Savior of the world. Their faith was not a mere readiness, but a firm and authentic trust, based on Jesus' own powerful words. The multitude rejoiced that so many truly believed. This serves as a reminder of the importance of actively advancing the kingdom of God, seeking guidance from the Spirit of counsel, and having faith in the impact of Jesus' words on the hearts of people.

Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: We have heard Him ourselves" sufficed to raise their faith to a point never attained by the Jews, and hardly as yet by the disciples—that He was "the Savior of the world." [ALFORD]
This incident is further remarkable as a rare instance of the Lord's ministry producing an awakening on a large scale. [OLSHAUSEN]
Marvin Vincent: Many more [πολλω πλει] . Literally, more by much; i e., far more, with reference to the simple polloi, many, in ver. 39.
John Calvin: By this example we are taught that we ought never to refrain from working, when we have it in our power to advance the kingdom of God.
If we are afraid that our readiness in complying may be liable to unfavorable reports, or may often prove to be useless, let us ask from Christ the Spirit of counsel to direct us.
The word believe is now used in a different sense; for it means not only that they were prepared for faith, but that they actually had a proper faith.
Archibald T. Robertson: Jesus was reaping more rapidly than the woman did.
But all were rejoicing that so many 'believed', really believed.
Many more (πολλω πλειους). 'More by much' (instrumental case πολλω) in comparison with just 'many' (πολλο) of verse John 4:39.
John Gill: When he was come into the city, and had preached to the inhabitants in general, a larger multitude than before believed in him as the Messiah, and professed him, and became followers of him.

Because of his own word; which came to them, not in word only, but in power, and was the power of God unto salvation to them; and was received by them, not as the word of man, but as the word of God; and it wrought effectually in them, and was an hammer to break their rocky hearts in pieces, and to bring them into subjection to himself, his Gospel and ordinances.

This shows, that their faith in him was founded on his own word, which fell with great weight upon them. It seems to have an emphasis laid upon it, his own word, in distinction from the woman's saying.

bhtAttempts.bht: The incident in John 4:41 is remarkable because it produced an awakening on a large scale, with many more people believing in Jesus as the Messiah. Their faith was not just a readiness for belief, but a true and proper faith in Him. Jesus was reaping a greater harvest than the Samaritan woman did, and the people were rejoicing that so many truly believed. Their faith was rooted in Jesus' own word, which had a powerful impact on their hearts and brought them into subjection to Him. This example teaches us the importance of not refraining from working to advance the kingdom of God, even if we are afraid of unfavorable reports or it may seem useless, and to seek the Spirit of counsel to guide us in our efforts to share the word of God.

The incident in this passage is significant as it brought about an awakening on a large scale, with many more people genuinely believing in Jesus as the Savior of the world. This shows that their faith was not just a readiness to believe, but a true and proper faith in Him. The people rejoiced that so many truly believed, and their faith was rooted in Jesus' own word, which had a powerful impact on their hearts. This example teaches us the importance of not hesitating to advance the kingdom of God and seeking guidance from the Spirit of counsel.

This remarkable incident sparked a widespread awakening, with many more people believing that Jesus was the Savior of the world. Their faith was not simply readiness, but a genuine trust in Him. The multitude rejoiced that so many truly believed, having been deeply impacted by Jesus' own words. This example underscores the importance of actively working to advance the kingdom of God and seeking guidance from the Spirit of counsel in our endeavors.

The remarkable awakening caused by Jesus' ministry in this incident led to a surge in genuine belief, as many more people recognized Him as the Savior of the world. Their faith was not a mere readiness, but a resolute and sincere trust, rooted in Jesus' own powerful words. The multitude joyfully celebrated the fact that so many now truly believed. This serves as a poignant reminder of the significance of actively advancing the kingdom of God and seeking guidance from the Spirit of counsel in our endeavors.

The remarkable awakening in this incident produced a surge of genuine belief, as many more people acknowledged Jesus as the Savior of the world. Their faith was not a mere readiness, but a firm and authentic trust, based on Jesus' own powerful words. The multitude rejoiced that so many truly believed. This serves as a reminder of the importance of actively advancing the kingdom of God, seeking guidance from the Spirit of counsel, and having faith in the impact of Jesus' words on the hearts of people.
